p: We have used LCA concepts to address the balance between reusable and disposable PPE, and to discuss how slow‐developing efforts to reduce our use of single‐use bags, cups, et cetera has been impacted by COVID‐19. Similarly, although some will exploit the fact that policy is changing as our understanding evolves, this also provides a clear illustration of how science (and the science–policy interface) works—how we learn as we go, challenge hypotheses with evolving data, and revise and adapt. Studies have illustrated that lockdown resulted in (some) reduced emissions, although many bounced back (e.g., Liu et al. 2020) or were displaced by other impacts. Such lessons can help us frame discussions on sustainable living and working, decarbonization, and other strategies for combatting climate change.
